XMLDB.COMMENT: XMLDB file for core Moodle tables

TABLE.NAME: config
TABLE.COMMENT: Moodle configuration variables

TABLE.NAME: config_plugins
TABLE.COMMENT: Moodle modules and plugins configuration variables

TABLE.NAME: config_log
TABLE.COMMENT: Changes done in server configuration through admin UI

TABLE.NAME: upgrade_log
TABLE.COMMENT: Upgrade logging

FIELD.NAME: type
FIELD.COMMENT: type: 0==info, 1==notice, 2==error

FIELD.NAME: version
FIELD.COMMENT: plugin or main version if known

FIELD.NAME: targetversion
FIELD.COMMENT: version of plugin or core specified in version.php at the time of upgrade loggging

TABLE.NAME: course
TABLE.COMMENT: Central course table

FIELD.NAME: legacyfiles
FIELD.COMMENT: course files are not necessary any more: 0 no legacy files, 1 legacy files disabled, 2 legacy files enabled

FIELD.NAME: visibleold
FIELD.COMMENT: the state of visible field when hiding parent category, this helps us to recover hidden states when unhiding the parent category later

FIELD.NAME: defaultgroupingid
FIELD.COMMENT: default grouping used in course modules, does not have key intentionally

FIELD.NAME: enablecompletion
FIELD.COMMENT: 1 = allow use of 'completion' progress-tracking on this course. 0 = disable completion tracking on this course.

FIELD.NAME: completionnotify
FIELD.COMMENT: Notify users when they complete this course

FIELD.NAME: cacherev
FIELD.COMMENT: Incrementing revision for validating the course content cache

TABLE.NAME: course_categories
TABLE.COMMENT: Course categories

FIELD.NAME: visibleold
FIELD.COMMENT: the state of visible field when hiding parent category, this helps us to recover hidden states when unhiding the parent category later

FIELD.NAME: theme
FIELD.COMMENT: Theme for the category

KEY.NAME: parent
KEY.COMMENT: note that to make this recursive FK working someday, the parent field must be declared NULL

TABLE.NAME: course_completion_aggr_methd
TABLE.COMMENT: Course completion aggregation methods for criteria

FIELD.NAME: criteriatype
FIELD.COMMENT: The criteria type we are aggregating, or NULL if complete course aggregation

FIELD.NAME: method
FIELD.COMMENT: 1 = all, 2 = any, 3 = fraction, 4 = unit

FIELD.NAME: value
FIELD.COMMENT: NULL = all/any, 0..1 for method 'fraction', > 0 for method 'unit'

TABLE.NAME: course_completion_criteria
TABLE.COMMENT: Course completion criteria

FIELD.NAME: criteriatype
FIELD.COMMENT: Type of criteria

FIELD.NAME: module
FIELD.COMMENT: Type of module (if using module criteria type)

FIELD.NAME: moduleinstance
FIELD.COMMENT: Module instance id (if using module criteria type)

FIELD.NAME: courseinstance
FIELD.COMMENT: Course instance id (if using course criteria type)

FIELD.NAME: enrolperiod
FIELD.COMMENT: Number of days after enrolment the course is completed (if using enrolperiod criteria type)

FIELD.NAME: timeend
FIELD.COMMENT: Timestamp of the date for course completion (if using date criteria type)

FIELD.NAME: gradepass
FIELD.COMMENT: The minimum grade needed to pass the course (if passing grade criteria enabled)

TABLE.NAME: course_completion_crit_compl
TABLE.COMMENT: Course completion user records

FIELD.NAME: criteriaid
FIELD.COMMENT: Completion criteria this references

FIELD.NAME: gradefinal
FIELD.COMMENT: The final grade for the course (included regardless of whether a passing grade was required)

FIELD.NAME: unenroled
FIELD.COMMENT: Timestamp when the user was unenroled

TABLE.NAME: course_completions
TABLE.COMMENT: Course completion records

TABLE.NAME: enrol
TABLE.COMMENT: Instances of enrolment plugins used in courses, fields marked as custom have a plugin defined meaning, core does not touch them. Create a new linked table if you need even more custom fields.

FIELD.NAME: status
FIELD.COMMENT: 0..9 are system constants, 0 means active enrolment, see ENROL_STATUS_* constants, plugins may define own status greater than 10

FIELD.NAME: sortorder
FIELD.COMMENT: order of enrol plugins in each course

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Optional instance name

FIELD.NAME: enrolperiod
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - enrolment duration

FIELD.NAME: enrolstartdate
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - start of self enrolment

FIELD.NAME: enrolenddate
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - end of enrolment

FIELD.NAME: expirynotify
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - notify users before expiration

FIELD.NAME: expirythreshold
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - when should be the participants notified

FIELD.NAME: notifyall
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - Notify both participant and person responsible for enrolments

FIELD.NAME: password
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - enrolment or access password

FIELD.NAME: cost
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - enrolment cost

FIELD.NAME: currency
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - cost currency

FIELD.NAME: roleid
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - the default role given to participants who self-enrol

FIELD.NAME: customint1
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general int

FIELD.NAME: customint2
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general int

FIELD.NAME: customint3
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general int

FIELD.NAME: customint4
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general int

FIELD.NAME: customint5
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general int

FIELD.NAME: customint6
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general int

FIELD.NAME: customint7
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general int

FIELD.NAME: customint8
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general int

FIELD.NAME: customchar1
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general short name

FIELD.NAME: customchar2
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general short name

FIELD.NAME: customchar3
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general short name

FIELD.NAME: customdec1
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general decimal

FIELD.NAME: customdec2
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general decimal

FIELD.NAME: customtext1
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general text

FIELD.NAME: customtext2
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general text

FIELD.NAME: customtext3
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general text

FIELD.NAME: customtext4
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom - general text

TABLE.NAME: user_enrolments
TABLE.COMMENT: Users participating in courses (aka enrolled users) - everybody who is participating/visible in course, that means both teachers and students

FIELD.NAME: status
FIELD.COMMENT: 0..9 are system constants, 0 means active participation, see ENROL_PARTICIPATION_* constants, plugins may define own status greater than 10

INDEX.NAME: enrolid-userid
INDEX.COMMENT: Only one enrolment per plugin allowed

TABLE.NAME: course_modules
TABLE.COMMENT: course_modules table retrofitted from MySQL

FIELD.NAME: idnumber
FIELD.COMMENT: customizable idnumber

FIELD.NAME: visibleoncoursepage
FIELD.COMMENT: If stealth visibility is allowed for the course, this controls whether activity is visible on course page

FIELD.NAME: completion
FIELD.COMMENT: Whether the completion-tracking facilities are enabled for this activity. 0 = not enabled (database default) 1 = manual tracking, user can tick this activity off (UI default for most activity types) 2 = automatic tracking, system should mark completion according to rules specified in course_moduleS_completion

FIELD.NAME: completiongradeitemnumber
FIELD.COMMENT: Grade-item number used to track automatic completion, if applicable.

FIELD.NAME: completionview
FIELD.COMMENT: Controls whether a page view is part of the automatic completion requirements for this activity. 0 = view not required 1 = view required

FIELD.NAME: completionexpected
FIELD.COMMENT: Date at which students are expected to complete this activity. This field is used when displaying student progress.

FIELD.NAME: showdescription
FIELD.COMMENT: Some module types support a 'description' which shows within the module pages. This option controls whether it also displays on the course main page. 0 = does not display (default), 1 = displays

FIELD.NAME: availability
FIELD.COMMENT: Availability restrictions for viewing this activity, in JSON format. Null if no restrictions.

INDEX.NAME: idnumber-course
INDEX.COMMENT: non unique index (although programatically we are guarantying some sort of uniqueness both under this table and the grade_items one). TODO: We need a central store of module idnumbers in the future.

TABLE.NAME: course_modules_completion
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores the completion state (completed or not completed, etc) of each user on each activity.

FIELD.NAME: coursemoduleid
FIELD.COMMENT: Activity that has been completed (or not).

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: ID of user who has (or hasn't) completed the activity.

FIELD.NAME: completionstate
FIELD.COMMENT: Whether or not the user has completed the activity. Available states: 0 = not completed [if there's no row in this table, that also counts as 0] 1 = completed 2 = completed, show passed 3 = completed, show failed

FIELD.NAME: viewed
FIELD.COMMENT: Tracks whether or not this activity has been viewed. NULL = we are not tracking viewed for this activity 0 = not viewed 1 = viewed

FIELD.NAME: overrideby
FIELD.COMMENT: Tracks whether this completion state has been set manually to override a previous state.

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: Time at which the completion state last changed.

INDEX.NAME: coursemoduleid
INDEX.COMMENT: For quick access via course-module (e.g. when displaying course module settings page and we need to determine whether anyone has completed it).

TABLE.NAME: course_sections
TABLE.COMMENT: to define the sections for each course

FIELD.NAME: availability
FIELD.COMMENT: Availability restrictions for viewing this section, in JSON format. Null if no restrictions.

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: Time at which the course section was last changed.

TABLE.NAME: course_request
TABLE.COMMENT: course requests

TABLE.NAME: course_format_options
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores format-specific options for the course or course section

FIELD.NAME: courseid
FIELD.COMMENT: Id of the course

FIELD.NAME: format
FIELD.COMMENT: Format this option is for

FIELD.NAME: sectionid
FIELD.COMMENT: Null if this is a course option, otherwise id of the section this option is for

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Name of the format option

FIELD.NAME: value
FIELD.COMMENT: Value of the format option

TABLE.NAME: filter_active
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores information about which filters are active in which contexts. Also the filter sort order. See get_active_filters in lib/filterlib.php for how this data is used.

FIELD.NAME: filter
FIELD.COMMENT: The filter internal name, like 'tex'.

FIELD.NAME: contextid
FIELD.COMMENT: References context.id.

FIELD.NAME: active
FIELD.COMMENT: Whether this filter is active in this context. +1 = On, -1 = Off, no row with this contextid = inherit. As a special case, when contextid points to the system context, -9999 means this filter is completely disabled.

FIELD.NAME: sortorder
FIELD.COMMENT: Only relevant if contextid points to the system context. In other cases this field should contain 0. The order in which the filters should be applied.

TABLE.NAME: filter_config
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores per-context configuration settings for filters which have them.

FIELD.NAME: filter
FIELD.COMMENT: The filter internal name, like 'tex'.

FIELD.NAME: contextid
FIELD.COMMENT: References context.id.

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: The config variable name.

FIELD.NAME: value
FIELD.COMMENT: The correspoding config variable value.

INDEX.NAME: contextid-filter-name
INDEX.COMMENT: In each context, at most one value per name per filter.

TABLE.NAME: event
TABLE.COMMENT: For everything with a time associated to it

FIELD.NAME: subscriptionid
FIELD.COMMENT: The event_subscription id this event is associated with.

FIELD.NAME: priority
FIELD.COMMENT: The event's display priority. For multiple events with the same module name, instance and eventtype (e.g. for group overrides), the one with the higher priority will be displayed.

TABLE.NAME: cache_filters
TABLE.COMMENT: For keeping information about cached data

TABLE.NAME: log
TABLE.COMMENT: Every action is logged as far as possible

TABLE.NAME: log_queries
TABLE.COMMENT: Logged database queries.

FIELD.NAME: qtype
FIELD.COMMENT: query type constant

FIELD.NAME: sqltext
FIELD.COMMENT: query sql

FIELD.NAME: sqlparams
FIELD.COMMENT: query parameters

FIELD.NAME: error
FIELD.COMMENT: is error

FIELD.NAME: info
FIELD.COMMENT: detailed info such as error text

FIELD.NAME: backtrace
FIELD.COMMENT: php execution trace

FIELD.NAME: exectime
FIELD.COMMENT: query execution time in seconds as float

FIELD.NAME: timelogged
FIELD.COMMENT: timestamp when log info stored into db

TABLE.NAME: log_display
TABLE.COMMENT: For a particular module/action, specifies a moodle table/field

FIELD.NAME: component
FIELD.COMMENT: owner of the log action

TABLE.NAME: message
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores all unread messages

FIELD.NAME: subject
FIELD.COMMENT: The message subject

FIELD.NAME: fullmessageformat
FIELD.COMMENT: The format of the full message

FIELD.NAME: fullmessagehtml
FIELD.COMMENT: html format of message

FIELD.NAME: smallmessage
FIELD.COMMENT: Smal version of message (eg sms)

FIELD.NAME: contexturl
FIELD.COMMENT: If this message is a notification of an event contexturl should contain a link to view this event. For example if its a notification of a forum post contexturl should contain a link to the forum post.

FIELD.NAME: contexturlname
FIELD.COMMENT: Display text for the contexturl

TABLE.NAME: message_read
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores all messages that have been read

FIELD.NAME: subject
FIELD.COMMENT: The message subject

FIELD.NAME: fullmessageformat
FIELD.COMMENT: The format of the full message

FIELD.NAME: fullmessagehtml
FIELD.COMMENT: html format of message

FIELD.NAME: smallmessage
FIELD.COMMENT: Smal version of message (eg sms)

FIELD.NAME: contexturl
FIELD.COMMENT: If this message is a notification of an event contexturl should contain a link to view this event. For example if its a notification of a forum post contexturl should contain a link to the forum post.

FIELD.NAME: contexturlname
FIELD.COMMENT: Display text for the contexturl

TABLE.NAME: message_contacts
TABLE.COMMENT: Maintains lists of relationships between users

TABLE.NAME: modules
TABLE.COMMENT: modules available in the site

TABLE.NAME: my_pages
TABLE.COMMENT: Extra user pages for the My Moodle system

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: The user who owns this page or 0 for system defaults

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: The page name (freeform text)

FIELD.NAME: private
FIELD.COMMENT: Whether or not the page is private (dashboard) or public (profile)

FIELD.NAME: sortorder
FIELD.COMMENT: The order of the pages for a user

TABLE.NAME: sessions
TABLE.COMMENT: Database based session storage - now recommended

FIELD.NAME: state
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 means normal session

FIELD.NAME: sid
FIELD.COMMENT: Session id

FIELD.NAME: sessdata
FIELD.COMMENT: session content

TABLE.NAME: user
TABLE.COMMENT: One record for each person

FIELD.NAME: suspended
FIELD.COMMENT: suspended flag prevents users to log in

FIELD.NAME: picture
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 means no image uploaded, positive values are revisions thta prevent caching problems, negative values are reserved for future use

FIELD.NAME: imagealt
FIELD.COMMENT: alt tag for user uploaded image

FIELD.NAME: lastnamephonetic
FIELD.COMMENT: Last name phonetic

FIELD.NAME: firstnamephonetic
FIELD.COMMENT: First name phonetic

FIELD.NAME: middlename
FIELD.COMMENT: Middle name

FIELD.NAME: alternatename
FIELD.COMMENT: Alternate name - Useful for three-name countries.

TABLE.NAME: user_preferences
TABLE.COMMENT: Allows modules to store arbitrary user preferences

TABLE.NAME: user_lastaccess
TABLE.COMMENT: To keep track of course page access times, used in online participants block, and participants list

TABLE.NAME: user_password_history
TABLE.COMMENT: A rotating log of hashes of previously used passwords for each user.

TABLE.NAME: scale
TABLE.COMMENT: Defines grading scales

TABLE.NAME: scale_history
TABLE.COMMENT: History table

FIELD.NAME: action
FIELD.COMMENT: created/modified/deleted constants

FIELD.NAME: source
FIELD.COMMENT: What caused the modification? manual/module/import/...

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: The last time this grade_item was modified

FIELD.NAME: loggeduser
FIELD.COMMENT: the userid of the person who last modified this outcome

TABLE.NAME: stats_daily
TABLE.COMMENT: to accumulate daily stats

FIELD.NAME: roleid
FIELD.COMMENT: id of role for the aggregates

FIELD.NAME: stattype
FIELD.COMMENT: type of stat

FIELD.NAME: stat1
FIELD.COMMENT: stat1. usually used for reads

FIELD.NAME: stat2
FIELD.COMMENT: stat2. usually used for writes.

TABLE.NAME: stats_weekly
TABLE.COMMENT: To accumulate weekly stats

FIELD.NAME: roleid
FIELD.COMMENT: id of role for the aggregates

FIELD.NAME: stattype
FIELD.COMMENT: type of stat

FIELD.NAME: stat1
FIELD.COMMENT: stat1. usually used for reads

FIELD.NAME: stat2
FIELD.COMMENT: stat2. usually used for writes.

TABLE.NAME: stats_monthly
TABLE.COMMENT: To accumulate monthly stats

FIELD.NAME: roleid
FIELD.COMMENT: id of role for the aggregates

FIELD.NAME: stattype
FIELD.COMMENT: type of stat

FIELD.NAME: stat1
FIELD.COMMENT: stat1. usually used for reads

FIELD.NAME: stat2
FIELD.COMMENT: stat2. usually used for writes.

TABLE.NAME: stats_user_daily
TABLE.COMMENT: To accumulate daily stats per course/user

TABLE.NAME: stats_user_weekly
TABLE.COMMENT: To accumulate weekly stats per course/user

TABLE.NAME: stats_user_monthly
TABLE.COMMENT: To accumulate monthly stats per course/user

TABLE.NAME: post
TABLE.COMMENT: Generic post table to hold data blog entries etc in different modules

TABLE.NAME: role
TABLE.COMMENT: moodle roles

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Empty names are automatically localised

FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.COMMENT: Empty descriptions may be automatically localised

FIELD.NAME: archetype
FIELD.COMMENT: Role archetype is used during install and role reset, marks admin role and helps in site settings

INDEX.NAME: shortname
INDEX.COMMENT: Enforces the constraint that role shortnames must be unique.

TABLE.NAME: context
TABLE.COMMENT: one of these must be set

TABLE.NAME: context_temp
TABLE.COMMENT: Used by build_context_path() in upgrade and cron to keep context depths and paths in sync.

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: This id isn't autonumeric/sequence. It's the context->id

TABLE.NAME: capabilities
TABLE.COMMENT: this defines all capabilities

TABLE.NAME: role_allow_assign
TABLE.COMMENT: this defines what role can assign what role

TABLE.NAME: role_allow_override
TABLE.COMMENT: this defines what role can override what role

TABLE.NAME: role_allow_switch
TABLE.COMMENT: This table stores which which other roles a user is allowed to switch to if they have one role.

FIELD.NAME: roleid
FIELD.COMMENT: The role the user has.

FIELD.NAME: allowswitch
FIELD.COMMENT: The id of a role that the user is allowed to switch to as a result of having this role.

INDEX.NAME: roleid-allowoverride
INDEX.COMMENT: Each pair (roleid, allowswitch) must appear at most once.

TABLE.NAME: role_assignments
TABLE.COMMENT: assigning roles in different context

FIELD.NAME: component
FIELD.COMMENT: plugin responsible responsible for role assignment, empty when manually assigned

FIELD.NAME: itemid
FIELD.COMMENT: Id of enrolment/auth instance responsible for this role assignment

INDEX.NAME: usercontextrole
INDEX.COMMENT: Index on userid, contextid and roleid

TABLE.NAME: role_capabilities
TABLE.COMMENT: permission has to be signed, overriding a capability for a particular role in a particular context

TABLE.NAME: role_names
TABLE.COMMENT: role names in native strings

TABLE.NAME: role_sortorder
TABLE.COMMENT: sort order of course managers in a course

TABLE.NAME: role_context_levels
TABLE.COMMENT: Lists which roles can be assigned at which context levels. The assignment is allowed in the corresponding row is present in this table.

TABLE.NAME: user_info_field
TABLE.COMMENT: Customisable user profile fields

FIELD.NAME: shortname
FIELD.COMMENT: short name for each field

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: field name

FIELD.NAME: datatype
FIELD.COMMENT: Type of data held in this field

FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.COMMENT: Description of field

FIELD.NAME: categoryid
FIELD.COMMENT: id from category table

FIELD.NAME: sortorder
FIELD.COMMENT: order within the category

FIELD.NAME: required
FIELD.COMMENT: Field required

FIELD.NAME: locked
FIELD.COMMENT: Field locked

FIELD.NAME: visible
FIELD.COMMENT: Visibility: private, public, hidden

FIELD.NAME: forceunique
FIELD.COMMENT: should the field contain unique data

FIELD.NAME: signup
FIELD.COMMENT: display field on signup page

FIELD.NAME: defaultdata
FIELD.COMMENT: Default value for this field

FIELD.NAME: param1
FIELD.COMMENT: General parameter field

FIELD.NAME: param2
FIELD.COMMENT: General parameter field

FIELD.NAME: param3
FIELD.COMMENT: General parameter field

FIELD.NAME: param4
FIELD.COMMENT: General parameter field

FIELD.NAME: param5
FIELD.COMMENT: General parameter field

TABLE.NAME: user_info_category
TABLE.COMMENT: Customisable fields categories

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Category name

FIELD.NAME: sortorder
FIELD.COMMENT: Display order

TABLE.NAME: user_info_data
TABLE.COMMENT: Data for the customisable user fields

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: id from the user table

FIELD.NAME: fieldid
FIELD.COMMENT: id from the field table

FIELD.NAME: data
FIELD.COMMENT: Field data

TABLE.NAME: question_categories
TABLE.COMMENT: Categories are for grouping questions

FIELD.NAME: contextid
FIELD.COMMENT: context that this category is shared in

KEY.NAME: parent
KEY.COMMENT: note that to make this recursive FK working someday, the parent field must be declared NULL

TABLE.NAME: question
TABLE.COMMENT: The questions themselves

FIELD.NAME: generalfeedback
FIELD.COMMENT: to store the question feedback

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: time question was created

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: time that question was last modified

FIELD.NAME: createdby
FIELD.COMMENT: userid of person who created this question

FIELD.NAME: modifiedby
FIELD.COMMENT: userid of person who last edited this question

KEY.NAME: parent
KEY.COMMENT: note that to make this recursive FK working someday, the parent field must be declared NULL

TABLE.NAME: question_answers
TABLE.COMMENT: Answers, with a fractional grade (0-1) and feedback

TABLE.NAME: question_hints
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores the the part of the question definition that gives different feedback after each try in interactive and similar behaviours.

FIELD.NAME: hint
FIELD.COMMENT: The text of the feedback to be given.

FIELD.NAME: hintformat
FIELD.COMMENT: The format of the hint.

FIELD.NAME: shownumcorrect
FIELD.COMMENT: Whether the feedback should include a message about how many things the student got right. This is only applicable to certain question types (for example matching or multiple choice multiple-response).

FIELD.NAME: clearwrong
FIELD.COMMENT: Whether any wrong choices should be cleared before the next try. Whether this is applicable, and what it means, depends on the question type, as with the shownumright option.

FIELD.NAME: options
FIELD.COMMENT: A space for any other question-type specific options.

TABLE.NAME: question_usages
TABLE.COMMENT: This table's main purpose it to assign a unique id to each attempt at a set of questions by some part of Moodle. A question usage is made up of a number of question_attempts.

FIELD.NAME: contextid
FIELD.COMMENT: Every question usage must be associated with some context.

FIELD.NAME: component
FIELD.COMMENT: The plugin this attempt belongs to, e.g. 'mod_quiz', 'block_questionoftheday', 'filter_embedquestion'.

FIELD.NAME: preferredbehaviour
FIELD.COMMENT: The archetypal behaviour that should be used for question attempts in this usage.

TABLE.NAME: question_attempts
TABLE.COMMENT: Each row here corresponds to an attempt at one question, as part of a question_usage. A question_attempt will have some question_attempt_steps

FIELD.NAME: questionusageid
FIELD.COMMENT: Foreign key, references question_usages.id

FIELD.NAME: slot
FIELD.COMMENT: Used to number the questions in one attempt sequentially.

FIELD.NAME: behaviour
FIELD.COMMENT: The name of the question behaviour that is managing this question attempt.

FIELD.NAME: questionid
FIELD.COMMENT: The id of the question being attempted. Foreign key references question.id.

FIELD.NAME: variant
FIELD.COMMENT: The variant of the qusetion being used.

FIELD.NAME: maxmark
FIELD.COMMENT: The grade this question is marked out of in this attempt.

FIELD.NAME: minfraction
FIELD.COMMENT: Some questions can award negative marks. This indicates the most negative mark that can be awarded, on the faction scale where the maximum positive mark is 1.

FIELD.NAME: maxfraction
FIELD.COMMENT: Some questions can give fractions greater than 1. This indicates the greatest fraction that can be awarded.

FIELD.NAME: flagged
FIELD.COMMENT: Whether this question has been flagged within the attempt.

FIELD.NAME: questionsummary
FIELD.COMMENT: If this question uses randomisation, it should set this field to summarise what random version the student actually saw. This is a human-readable textual summary of the student's response which might, for example, be used in a report.

FIELD.NAME: rightanswer
FIELD.COMMENT: This is a human-readable textual summary of the right answer to this question. Might be used, for example on the quiz preview, to help people who are testing the question. Or might be used in reports.

FIELD.NAME: responsesummary
FIELD.COMMENT: This is a textual summary of the student's response (basically what you would expect to in the Quiz responses report).

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: The time this record was last changed.

INDEX.NAME: behaviour
INDEX.COMMENT: Required because we need to be able to determine efficiently which behaviours are in use.

TABLE.NAME: question_attempt_steps
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores one step in in a question attempt. As well as the data here, the step will have some data in the question_attempt_step_data table.

FIELD.NAME: questionattemptid
FIELD.COMMENT: Foreign key, references question_attempt.id

FIELD.NAME: sequencenumber
FIELD.COMMENT: Numbers the steps in a question attempt sequentially.

FIELD.NAME: state
FIELD.COMMENT: One of the constants defined by the question_state class, giving the state of the question at the end of this step.

FIELD.NAME: fraction
FIELD.COMMENT: The grade for this question, when graded out of 1. Needs to be multiplied by question_attempt.maxmark to get the actual mark for the question.

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: Time-stamp of the action that lead to this state being created.

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: The user whose action lead to this state being created.

TABLE.NAME: question_attempt_step_data
TABLE.COMMENT: Each question_attempt_step has an associative array of the data that was submitted by the user in the POST request. It can also contain extra data from the question type or behaviour to avoid re-computation. The convention is that names belonging to the behaviour start with -, and cached values added to the submitted data start with _, or _-

FIELD.NAME: attemptstepid
FIELD.COMMENT: Foreign key, references question_attempt_steps.id

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: The name of this bit of data.

FIELD.NAME: value
FIELD.COMMENT: The corresponding value

TABLE.NAME: question_statistics
TABLE.COMMENT: Statistics for individual questions used in an activity.

FIELD.NAME: hashcode
FIELD.COMMENT: sha1 hash of serialized qubaids_condition class. Unique for every combination of class name and property.

FIELD.NAME: slot
FIELD.COMMENT: The position in the quiz where this question appears

FIELD.NAME: positions
FIELD.COMMENT: positions in which this item appears. Only used for random questions.

FIELD.NAME: randomguessscore
FIELD.COMMENT: An estimate of the score a student would get by guessing randomly.

TABLE.NAME: question_response_analysis
TABLE.COMMENT: Analysis of student responses given to questions.

FIELD.NAME: hashcode
FIELD.COMMENT: sha1 hash of serialized qubaids_condition class. Unique for every combination of class name and property.

TABLE.NAME: question_response_count
TABLE.COMMENT: Count for each responses for each try at a question.

TABLE.NAME: mnet_application
TABLE.COMMENT: Information about applications on remote hosts

TABLE.NAME: mnet_host
TABLE.COMMENT: Information about the local and remote hosts for RPC

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique Host ID

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_host table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_host2service
TABLE.COMMENT: Information about the services for a given host

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_host2service table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_log
TABLE.COMMENT: Store session data from users migrating to other sites

FIELD.NAME: hostid
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique host ID

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_log table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_rpc
TABLE.COMMENT: Functions or methods that we may publish or subscribe to

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique Function ID

FIELD.NAME: profile
FIELD.COMMENT: Method signature

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_rpc table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_remote_rpc
TABLE.COMMENT: This table describes functions that might be called remotely (we have less information about them than local functions)

TABLE.NAME: mnet_service
TABLE.COMMENT: A service is a group of functions

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique Service ID

FIELD.NAME: offer
FIELD.COMMENT: Do we even offer this service?

KEY.NAME: primary

TABLE.NAME: events_queue
TABLE.COMMENT: This table is for storing queued events. It stores only one copy of the eventdata here, and entries from this table are being references by the event_queue_handlers table.

FIELD.NAME: eventdata
FIELD.COMMENT: serialized version of the data object passed to the event handler.

FIELD.NAME: stackdump
FIELD.COMMENT: serialized debug_backtrace showing where the event was fired from

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: $USER->id when the event was fired

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: time stamp of the first time this was added

TABLE.NAME: events_handlers
TABLE.COMMENT: This table is for storing which components requests what type of event, and the location of the responsible handlers. For example, the assignment registers 'grade_updated' event with a function assignment_grade_handler() that should be called event time an 'grade_updated' event is triggered by grade_update() function.

FIELD.NAME: eventname
FIELD.COMMENT: name of the event, e.g. 'grade_updated'

FIELD.NAME: component
FIELD.COMMENT: e.g. moodle, mod_forum, block_rss_client

FIELD.NAME: handlerfile
FIELD.COMMENT: path to the file of the function, eg /grade/export/lib.php

FIELD.NAME: handlerfunction
FIELD.COMMENT: serialized string or array describing function, suitable to be passed to call_user_func()

FIELD.NAME: schedule
FIELD.COMMENT: 'cron' or 'instant'.

FIELD.NAME: status
FIELD.COMMENT: number of failed attempts to process this handler

FIELD.NAME: internal
FIELD.COMMENT: 1 means standard plugin handler, 0 indicates if event handler sends data to external systems, this is used for example to prevent immediate sending of events from pending db transactions

TABLE.NAME: events_queue_handlers
TABLE.COMMENT: This is the list of queued handlers for processing. The event object is retrieved from the events_queue table. When no further reference is made to the event_queues table, the corresponding entry in the events_queue table should be deleted. Entry should get deleted after a successful event processing by the specified handler.

FIELD.NAME: queuedeventid
FIELD.COMMENT: foreign key id corresponding to the id of the event_queues table

FIELD.NAME: handlerid
FIELD.COMMENT: foreign key id corresponding to the id of the event_handlers table

FIELD.NAME: status
FIELD.COMMENT: number of failed attempts to process this handler

FIELD.NAME: errormessage
FIELD.COMMENT: if an error happened last time we tried to process this event, record it here.

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: time stamp of the last attempt to run this from the queue

TABLE.NAME: grade_outcomes
TABLE.COMMENT: This table describes the outcomes used in the system. An outcome is a statement tied to a rubric scale from low to high, such as âNot met, Borderline, Metâ (stored as 0,1 or 2)

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the table

FIELD.NAME: courseid
FIELD.COMMENT: Mostly these are defined site wide ie NULL

FIELD.NAME: shortname
FIELD.COMMENT: The short name or code for this outcome statement

FIELD.NAME: fullname
FIELD.COMMENT: The full description of the outcome (usually 1 sentence)

FIELD.NAME: scaleid
FIELD.COMMENT: The recommended scale for this outcome.

FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.COMMENT: outcome description

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: the time this outcome was first created

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: the time this outcome was last updated

FIELD.NAME: usermodified
FIELD.COMMENT: the userid of the person who last modified this outcome

TABLE.NAME: grade_outcomes_courses
TABLE.COMMENT: stores what outcomes are used in what courses.

FIELD.NAME: courseid
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the course

FIELD.NAME: outcomeid
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the outcome

TABLE.NAME: grade_categories
TABLE.COMMENT: This table keeps information about categories, used for grouping items.

FIELD.NAME: courseid
FIELD.COMMENT: The course this grade category is part of

FIELD.NAME: parent
FIELD.COMMENT: Categories can be hierarchical

FIELD.NAME: depth
FIELD.COMMENT: How many parents does this category have?

FIELD.NAME: path
FIELD.COMMENT: shows the path as /1/2/3 (like course_categories)

FIELD.NAME: fullname
FIELD.COMMENT: The name of this grade category

FIELD.NAME: aggregation
FIELD.COMMENT: A constant pointing to one of the predefined aggregation strategies (none, mean,median,sum, etc)

FIELD.NAME: keephigh
FIELD.COMMENT: Keep only the X highest items

FIELD.NAME: droplow
FIELD.COMMENT: Drop the X lowest items

FIELD.NAME: aggregateonlygraded
FIELD.COMMENT: aggregate only graded activities

FIELD.NAME: aggregateoutcomes
FIELD.COMMENT: Aggregate outcomes

TABLE.NAME: grade_items
TABLE.COMMENT: This table keeps information about gradeable items (ie columns). If an activity (eg an assignment or quiz) has multiple grade_items associated with it (eg several outcomes or numerical grades), then there will be a corresponding multiple number of rows in this table.

FIELD.NAME: courseid
FIELD.COMMENT: The course this item is part of

FIELD.NAME: categoryid
FIELD.COMMENT: (optional) the category group this item belongs to

FIELD.NAME: itemname
FIELD.COMMENT: The name of this item (pushed in by the module)

FIELD.NAME: itemtype
FIELD.COMMENT: 'mod', 'blocks', 'import', 'calculated' etc

FIELD.NAME: itemmodule
FIELD.COMMENT: 'forum', 'quiz', 'csv', etc

FIELD.NAME: iteminstance
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the item module

FIELD.NAME: itemnumber
FIELD.COMMENT: Can be used to distinguish multiple grades for an activity

FIELD.NAME: iteminfo
FIELD.COMMENT: Info and notes about this item XXX

FIELD.NAME: idnumber
FIELD.COMMENT: Arbitrary idnumber provided by the module responsible

FIELD.NAME: calculation
FIELD.COMMENT: Formula describing how to derive this grade from other items, referring to them using giXXX where XXX is grade item id ... eg something like: =sin(square([#gi20#])) + [#gi30#]

FIELD.NAME: gradetype
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 = none, 1 = value, 2 = scale, 3 = text

FIELD.NAME: grademax
FIELD.COMMENT: What is the maximum allowable grade?

FIELD.NAME: grademin
FIELD.COMMENT: What is the minimum allowable grade?

FIELD.NAME: scaleid
FIELD.COMMENT: If this grade is based on a scale, which one is it?

FIELD.NAME: outcomeid
FIELD.COMMENT: If this grade is related to an outcome, which one is it?

FIELD.NAME: gradepass
FIELD.COMMENT: What grade is needed to pass? grademin < gradepass <= grademax

FIELD.NAME: multfactor
FIELD.COMMENT: Multiply all grades by this

FIELD.NAME: plusfactor
FIELD.COMMENT: Add this to all grades

FIELD.NAME: aggregationcoef
FIELD.COMMENT: Aggregation coefficient used for category weights or other aggregation types

FIELD.NAME: aggregationcoef2
FIELD.COMMENT: Aggregation coefficient used for weights in aggregation types with both extra credit and weight

FIELD.NAME: sortorder
FIELD.COMMENT: Sorting order of the columns

FIELD.NAME: display
FIELD.COMMENT: Display as real grades, percentages (in reference to the minimum and maximum grades) or letters (A, B, C etc..), or course default (0)

FIELD.NAME: decimals
FIELD.COMMENT: Also known as precision, the number of digits after the decimal point symbol.

FIELD.NAME: hidden
FIELD.COMMENT: 1 is hidden, > 1 is a date to hide until (prevents viewing)

FIELD.NAME: locked
FIELD.COMMENT: 1 is locked, > 1 is a date to lock until (prevents update)

FIELD.NAME: locktime
FIELD.COMMENT: lock all final grades after this date

FIELD.NAME: needsupdate
FIELD.COMMENT: If this flag is set, then the whole column will be recalculated

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: The first time this grade_item was created

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: The last time this grade_item was modified

INDEX.NAME: idnumber-courseid
INDEX.COMMENT: non unique index (although programatically we are guarantying some sort of uniqueness both under this table and the course_modules one). TODO: We need a central store of module idnumbers in the future.

TABLE.NAME: grade_grades
TABLE.COMMENT: grade_grades This table keeps individual grades for each user and each item, exactly as imported or submitted by modules. The rawgrademax/min and rawscaleid are stored here to record the values at the time the grade was stored, because teachers might change this for an activity! All the results are normalised/resampled for the final grade value.

FIELD.NAME: itemid
FIELD.COMMENT: The item this grade belongs to

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: The user who this grade is for

FIELD.NAME: rawgrade
FIELD.COMMENT: If the grade is a float value (or has been converted to one)

FIELD.NAME: rawgrademax
FIELD.COMMENT: The maximum allowable grade when this was created

FIELD.NAME: rawgrademin
FIELD.COMMENT: The minimum allowable grade when this was created

FIELD.NAME: rawscaleid
FIELD.COMMENT: If this grade is based on a scale, which one was it?

FIELD.NAME: usermodified
FIELD.COMMENT: the userid of the person who last modified this grade

FIELD.NAME: finalgrade
FIELD.COMMENT: The final grade (cached) after all calculations are made

FIELD.NAME: hidden
FIELD.COMMENT: show 0, hide 1 or hide until date

FIELD.NAME: locked
FIELD.COMMENT: not locked 0, locked from date

FIELD.NAME: locktime
FIELD.COMMENT: automatic locking of final grade, 0 means none, date otherwise

FIELD.NAME: exported
FIELD.COMMENT: date of last grade export, 0 if none

FIELD.NAME: overridden
FIELD.COMMENT: indicates grade overridden from gradebook, 0 means none, date means overridden

FIELD.NAME: excluded
FIELD.COMMENT: grade excluded from aggregation functions, date means when excluded

FIELD.NAME: feedback
FIELD.COMMENT: grading feedback

FIELD.NAME: feedbackformat
FIELD.COMMENT: format of feedback text

FIELD.NAME: information
FIELD.COMMENT: optiona information

FIELD.NAME: informationformat
FIELD.COMMENT: format of information text

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: the time this grade was first created

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: the time this grade was last modified

FIELD.NAME: aggregationstatus
FIELD.COMMENT: One of several values describing how this grade_grade was used when calculating the aggregation. Possible values are "unknown", "dropped", "novalue", "used"

FIELD.NAME: aggregationweight
FIELD.COMMENT: If the aggregationstatus == 'included', then this is the percent this item contributed to the aggregation.

KEY.NAME: userid-itemid
KEY.COMMENT: one entry per user per item

TABLE.NAME: tag_coll
TABLE.COMMENT: Defines different set of tags

FIELD.COMMENT: Whether the tag collection is searchable

FIELD.NAME: customurl
FIELD.COMMENT: Custom URL for the tag page instead of /tag/index.php

TABLE.COMMENT: Defines various tag areas, one area is identified by component and itemtype

TABLE.COMMENT: Tag table - this generic table will replace the old "tags" table.

FIELD.NAME: rawname
FIELD.COMMENT: The raw, unnormalised name for the tag as entered by users

FIELD.NAME: isstandard
FIELD.COMMENT: Whether this tag is standard

FIELD.NAME: flag
FIELD.COMMENT: a tag can be 'flagged' as inappropriate

TABLE.NAME: tag_correlation
TABLE.COMMENT: The rationale for the 'tag_correlation' table is performance. It works as a cache for a potentially heavy load query done at the 'tag_instance' table. So, the 'tag_correlation' table stores redundant information derived from the 'tag_instance' table

TABLE.NAME: tag_instance
TABLE.COMMENT: tag_instance table holds the information of associations between tags and other items

FIELD.NAME: component
FIELD.COMMENT: Defines the Moodle component which the tag was added to

FIELD.NAME: contextid
FIELD.COMMENT: The context id of the item that was tagged

FIELD.NAME: ordering
FIELD.COMMENT: Maintains the order of the tag instances of an item

TABLE.NAME: groups
TABLE.COMMENT: Each record represents a group.

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Short human readable unique name for the group.

TABLE.NAME: groupings
TABLE.COMMENT: A grouping is a collection of groups. WAS: groups_groupings

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Short human readable unique name for group.

FIELD.NAME: configdata
FIELD.COMMENT: extra configuration data - may be used by group IU tools

TABLE.NAME: groups_members
TABLE.COMMENT: Link a user to a group.

FIELD.NAME: component
FIELD.COMMENT: Defines the Moodle component which added this group membership (e.g. 'auth_myplugin'), or blank if it was added manually. (Entries which are created by a Moodle component cannot be removed in the normal user interface.)

FIELD.NAME: itemid
FIELD.COMMENT: If the 'component' field is set, this can be used to define the instance of the component that created the entry. Otherwise should be left as default (0).

TABLE.NAME: groupings_groups
TABLE.COMMENT: Link a grouping to a group (note, groups can be in multiple groupings ONLY in a course). WAS: groups_groupings_groups

TABLE.NAME: cohort
TABLE.COMMENT: Each record represents one cohort (aka site-wide group).

FIELD.NAME: contextid
FIELD.COMMENT: Context is usually ignored in sync operations so that the cohorts may be moved freely around in the context tree without any side affects.

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Short human readable name for the cohort, does not have to be unique

FIELD.NAME: idnumber
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique identifier of a cohort, useful especially for mapping to external entities

FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.COMMENT: Standard description text box

FIELD.NAME: visible
FIELD.COMMENT: Visibility to teachers

FIELD.NAME: component
FIELD.COMMENT: Component (plugintype_pluignname) that manages the cohort, manual modifications are allowed only when set to NULL

TABLE.NAME: cohort_members
TABLE.COMMENT: Link a user to a cohort.

FIELD.NAME: iprestriction

FIELD.NAME: validuntil

FIELD.NAME: timecreated

TABLE.COMMENT: Repository for grade letters, for courses and other moodle entities that use grades.

FIELD.NAME: contextid
FIELD.COMMENT: What contextid does this letter apply to (for now these will always be courses, but later...)

FIELD.NAME: lowerboundary
FIELD.COMMENT: The lower boundary of the letter. Its upper boundary is the lower boundary of the next highest letter, unless there is none above, in which case it's grademax for that grade_item.

FIELD.NAME: letter
FIELD.COMMENT: The display value of the letter. Can be any character or string of characters (OK, A, 10% etc..)

INDEX.NAME: contextid-lowerboundary-letter
INDEX.COMMENT: index used when fetching context letters

TABLE.COMMENT: Cache of time-sensitive flags

FIELD.NAME: visible
FIELD.COMMENT: whether this instance is visible or not

FIELD.COMMENT: instance of plugin we're configurating

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: config field

FIELD.NAME: value
FIELD.COMMENT: config value

FIELD.COMMENT: fk to instance table

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: fk to user table

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: name of config item

FIELD.NAME: value
FIELD.COMMENT: value of config item

TABLE.NAME: portfolio_log
TABLE.COMMENT: log of portfolio transfers (used to later check for duplicates)

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: user who exported content

FIELD.NAME: time
FIELD.COMMENT: time of transfer (in the case of a queued transfer this is the time the actual transfer ran, not when the user started)

FIELD.NAME: portfolio
FIELD.COMMENT: fk to portfolio_instance

FIELD.NAME: caller_class
FIELD.COMMENT: the name of the class used to create the transfer

FIELD.NAME: caller_file
FIELD.COMMENT: path to file to include where the class definition lives. (relative to dirroot)

FIELD.NAME: caller_component
FIELD.COMMENT: the component name responsible for exporting

FIELD.NAME: caller_sha1
FIELD.COMMENT: sha1 of exported content as far as the caller is concerned (before the portfolio plugin gets a hold of it)

FIELD.NAME: tempdataid
FIELD.COMMENT: old id from portfolio_tempdata. This is so that we can gracefully catch a race condition between an external system requesting a file and causing the tempdata to be deleted, before the user gets the "your transfer is requested" page

FIELD.NAME: returnurl
FIELD.COMMENT: the original "returnurl" of the export - takes us to the moodle page we started from

FIELD.NAME: continueurl
FIELD.COMMENT: the url the external system has set to view the transfer

TABLE.NAME: portfolio_tempdata
TABLE.COMMENT: stores temporary data for portfolio exports. the id of this table is used for the itemid for the temporary files area. cron can clean up stale records (and associated file data) after expirytime.

FIELD.NAME: data
FIELD.COMMENT: dumping ground for portfolio callers to store their data in.

FIELD.NAME: expirytime
FIELD.COMMENT: time this record will expire (used for cron cleanups) - the start of export + 24 hours

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: psuedo fk to user. this is stored in the serialised data structure in the data field, but added here for ease of lookups.

FIELD.NAME: instance
FIELD.COMMENT: which portfolio plugin instance is being used

FIELD.NAME: queued
FIELD.COMMENT: Value 1 means the entry should be processed in cron.

TABLE.NAME: files
TABLE.COMMENT: description of files, content is stored in sha1 file pool

FIELD.NAME: contenthash
FIELD.COMMENT: sha1 hash of file content

FIELD.NAME: pathnamehash
FIELD.COMMENT: complete file path sha1 hash - unique for each file

FIELD.NAME: contextid
FIELD.COMMENT: The context id defined in context table - identifies the instance of plugin owning the file

FIELD.NAME: component
FIELD.COMMENT: Full name of the component owning the area

FIELD.NAME: filearea
FIELD.COMMENT: Like "coursefiles". "submission", "intro" and "content" (images and swf linked from summaries), etc.

FIELD.NAME: itemid
FIELD.COMMENT: Optional - some plugin specific item id (eg. forum post, blog entry or assignment submission, user id for user files)

FIELD.NAME: filepath
FIELD.COMMENT: Optional - relative path to file from module content root, useful in Scorm and Resource mod - most of the mods do not need this

FIELD.NAME: filename
FIELD.COMMENT: The full Unicode name of this file (case sensitive) - some chars are not allowed though

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: Optional - general userid field - meaning depending on plugin

FIELD.NAME: mimetype
FIELD.COMMENT: type of file - jpeg image, open document spreadsheet

FIELD.NAME: status
FIELD.COMMENT: number greater than 0 means something is wrong with this file (virus, missing, etc.)

FIELD.NAME: source
FIELD.COMMENT: contains the reference if the file is imported from external sites

FIELD.NAME: author
FIELD.COMMENT: The original author of the file

FIELD.NAME: license
FIELD.COMMENT: license of the file to guide reuse

FIELD.NAME: sortorder
FIELD.COMMENT: order of files

FIELD.NAME: referencefileid
FIELD.COMMENT: Use to indicate file is a proxy for repository file

TABLE.NAME: files_reference
TABLE.COMMENT: Store files references

FIELD.NAME: lastsync
FIELD.COMMENT: Last time the proxy file was synced with repository

FIELD.NAME: reference
FIELD.COMMENT: Identification of the external file. Repository plugins are interpreting it to locate the external file.

FIELD.NAME: referencehash
FIELD.COMMENT: Internal implementation detail, contains SHA1 hash of the reference field. Can be indexed and used for comparison. Not meant to be used by a non-core code.

INDEX.NAME: uq_external_file
INDEX.COMMENT: The combination of repositoryid and reference field is supposed to be a unique identification of an external file. Because the reference is a TEXT field, we can't use to compose the index. So we use the referencehash instead and the file API is responsible to keep it up-to-date

TABLE.NAME: file_conversion
TABLE.COMMENT: Table to track file conversions.

TABLE.NAME: repository
TABLE.COMMENT: This table contains one entry for every configured external repository instance.

TABLE.NAME: repository_instances
TABLE.COMMENT: This table contains one entry for every configured external repository instance.

TABLE.NAME: repository_instance_config
TABLE.COMMENT: The config for intances

TABLE.NAME: backup_courses
TABLE.COMMENT: To store every course backup status

TABLE.NAME: block
TABLE.COMMENT: contains all installed blocks

TABLE.NAME: block_instances
TABLE.COMMENT: This table stores block instances. The type of block this is is given by the blockname column. The places this block instance appears is controlled by the parentcontexid, showinsubcontexts, pagetypepattern and subpagepattern fields. Where the block appears on the page (by default) is controlled by the defaultposition and defaultweight columns. The block's own configuration is stored serialized in configdata.

FIELD.NAME: blockname
FIELD.COMMENT: The type of block this is. Foreign key, references block.name.

FIELD.NAME: parentcontextid
FIELD.COMMENT: The context within which this block appears. Foreign key, references context.id.

FIELD.NAME: showinsubcontexts
FIELD.COMMENT: If 1, this block appears on all matching pages in subcontexts of parentcontextid, as well in pages belonging to parentcontextid.

FIELD.NAME: requiredbytheme
FIELD.COMMENT: If 1, this block was created because it was required by the theme and did not exist.

FIELD.NAME: pagetypepattern
FIELD.COMMENT: The types of page this block appears on. Either an exact page type like mod-quiz-view, or a pattern like mod-quiz-* or course-view-*. Note that course-view-* will match course-view.

FIELD.NAME: subpagepattern
FIELD.COMMENT: Further restrictions on where this block appears. In some places, e.g. during a quiz or lesson attempt, different pages have different subpage ids. If this field is not null, the block only appears on that particular subpage.

FIELD.NAME: defaultregion
FIELD.COMMENT: Which block region this block should appear in on each page, in the absence of a specific position in the block_positions table.

FIELD.NAME: defaultweight
FIELD.COMMENT: Used to order the blocks within a block region. Again, may be overridden by the block_positions table for a specific page where this block appears.

FIELD.NAME: configdata
FIELD.COMMENT: A serialized blob of configuration data for this block instance.

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: Time at which this block instance was originally created

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: Time at which block instance was last modified.

TABLE.NAME: block_positions
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores the position of a sticky block_instance on a another page than the one where it was added.

FIELD.NAME: blockinstanceid
FIELD.COMMENT: The block_instance this position relates to.

FIELD.NAME: contextid
FIELD.COMMENT: With pagetype and subpage, defines the page we are setting the position for.

FIELD.NAME: pagetype
FIELD.COMMENT: With contextid and subpage, defines the page we are setting the position for.

FIELD.NAME: subpage
FIELD.COMMENT: With contextid and pagetype, defines the page we are setting the position for.

FIELD.NAME: visible
FIELD.COMMENT: Whether this block instance is visible on this page.

FIELD.NAME: region
FIELD.COMMENT: Which block region on this page this block should appear in.

FIELD.NAME: weight
FIELD.COMMENT: Used to order the blocks within a block region.

TABLE.NAME: external_tokens
TABLE.COMMENT: Security tokens for accessing of external services

FIELD.COMMENT: type of token: 0=permanent, no session; 1=linked to current browser session via sid; 2=permanent, with emulated session

FIELD.COMMENT: link to browser or emulated session

FIELD.COMMENT: user id of the token creator (useful to know when the administrator created a token and so display the token to a specific administrator)

TABLE.COMMENT: Details for an oauth 2 connect identity issuer.

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: Time this record was created.

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: Time this record was modified.

FIELD.NAME: usermodified
FIELD.COMMENT: The user who modified this record

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: The name of this identity issuer

FIELD.NAME: baseurl
FIELD.COMMENT: The base url to the issuer

FIELD.NAME: clientid
FIELD.COMMENT: The client id used to connect to this oauth2 service.

FIELD.NAME: clientsecret
FIELD.COMMENT: The secret used to connect to this oauth2 service.

FIELD.NAME: loginscopes
FIELD.COMMENT: The scopes requested for a normal login attempt.

FIELD.NAME: loginscopesoffline
FIELD.COMMENT: The scopes requested for a login attempt to generate a refresh token.

FIELD.NAME: loginparams
FIELD.COMMENT: Additional parameters sent for a login attempt.

FIELD.NAME: loginparamsoffline
FIELD.COMMENT: Additional parameters sent for a login attempt to generate a refresh token.

FIELD.NAME: alloweddomains
FIELD.COMMENT: Allowed domains for this issuer.

FIELD.NAME: scopessupported
FIELD.COMMENT: The list of scopes this service supports.

FIELD.NAME: basicauth
FIELD.COMMENT: Use HTTP Basic authentication scheme when sending client ID and password

FIELD.NAME: sortorder
FIELD.COMMENT: The defined sort order.

TABLE.NAME: oauth2_system_account
TABLE.COMMENT: Stored details used to get an access token as a system user for this oauth2 service.

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: Time this record was created.

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: Time this record was modified.

FIELD.NAME: usermodified
FIELD.COMMENT: The user who modified this record.

FIELD.NAME: issuerid
FIELD.COMMENT: The id of the oauth 2 identity issuer

FIELD.NAME: refreshtoken
FIELD.COMMENT: The refresh token used to request access tokens.

FIELD.NAME: grantedscopes
FIELD.COMMENT: The scopes that this system account has been granted access to.

FIELD.NAME: email
FIELD.COMMENT: The email that was connected to this issuer.

FIELD.NAME: username
FIELD.COMMENT: The username that was connected as a system account to this issue.

TABLE.COMMENT: List of analysables used by each model

TABLE.NAME: search_index_requests
TABLE.COMMENT: Records requests for (re)indexing of specific contexts. Entries will be removed from this table when indexing of that context is complete. (This table is not used for normal time-based indexing of new content.)

FIELD.NAME: contextid
FIELD.COMMENT: Context ID that has been requested for reindexing.

FIELD.NAME: searcharea
FIELD.COMMENT: Set (e.g. 'forum-post') if a specific area is to be reindexed. Blank indicates all areas.

FIELD.NAME: timerequested
FIELD.COMMENT: Time at which this index update was requested.

FIELD.NAME: partialarea
FIELD.COMMENT: If processing of this context partially completed, set to the area that needs processing next. Blank indicates not processed yet.

FIELD.NAME: partialtime
FIELD.COMMENT: If processing partially completed, set to the timestamp within the next area where processing should start. 0 indicates not processed yet.
